thread.title: Group of Kiwis immortalised on Google Street View in Italy
thread.title_full: Group of Kiwis immortalised on Google Street View in Italy

title: Group of Kiwis immortalised on Google Street View in Italy
text:
Group of Kiwis immortalised on Google Street View in Italy Last updated 17:59, October 13 2015 SUPPLIED 
The Kiwis thought fast when they spotted the Google car in the Italian town of Cortina 
A group of New Zealanders on holiday in the Italian mountains have now become permanent (digital) parts of the the stunning scenery. 
On their way into the town of Cortina in the Dolomite mountain range in northern Italy the group spotted a Google car that shoots the footage for Google Maps street view. 
"It is this mythical thing that exists, and you see the results, but you very rarely see the source," said Luke Leuschke, an Auckland architect. SUPPLIED 
Kiwis abroad caught on Google Street View 
Suddenly someone yelled: "It's the Google car!" 
The group struck a range of poses as the Google car rolled past, and their efforts are now forever captured on Google maps, the beautiful mountains in the background (or at least until the car comes back in a few years). 
"We had a split second to react. We knew we were about to be immortalised by Google," said Leuschke. supplied 
The Google Street View car approaches. 
Unfortunately, those at the back of the group can't have heard the warning and appear surprised, and in some cases oblivious to the crucial moment. 
"I'm just gutted I didn't strike a better pose," said Auckland builder Joe Hall. 
The group had checked in on Google maps a number of times since their holiday, but there was no change on the original image. This week they discovered their fame had arrived. 
"Yesterday I saw a funny car while I was having lunch, and I thought I have to check. And it was there," said Leuschke.
